website_summaries.verdict: If you need a large wrench and superior quality that's designed to last, this is the one to get. However, it may be too much if you just need a wrench for tasks around the house.
pros: A large, adjustable wrench (15-inch) that's constructed to tackle large projects with its forged steel craftsmanship
A lifetime warranty backs its superior quality
cons: Pricey, but it's also a serious, well-made wrench
Heavy and bulky – not ideal for small to moderate tasks and won't fit tight areas

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The auger screw that tightens and loosens the jaw still has casting marks and causes a lot of friction. Once you adjust the jaw and tighten a nut, there's no way to get the Jaws back open again so you can get the wrench off the nut. The screw just will not move. The bad surface finish causes too much friction. I have to beat it with a hammer to get it to loosen the jaw. The 15-inch version at Harbor Freight is much better made, that should tell you something.
customer_reviews.author: The Novice

customer_reviews.title: UNDERRATED
customer_reviews.text: I have the 15" version that claims to have a 1 3/4" opening capacity. When measured by a digital caliper my narrowest point of opening was very close to 2" at 1.976". The wrenches are well made and to my mind represent value and money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It's BIG!
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research, I chose this wrench because it's drop forged so is stronger and more durable .Bought it in case of an emergency whereby I'd need to shut off the main gas line to my house so I haven't use it yet it for that yet. Handle is substantial so turning should be easier. Update: 2/19/18 Have used it to untighten a coupler on my electric pressure washer that my channel lock and towel couldn't do. There are no teeth on the jaw which is very good as it won't mar up anything it's (un) tightening. Coupler came off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, compact little tool
customer_reviews.text: I own a Bogen Tripod approximately 35 years old. Still a good usable platform after all these years. The problem is, the levers that lock the legs are VERY stiff. As a man in my sixties with arthritis creeping into my fingers, I needed the kind of leverage I found in this compact little tool. The Olympia not only worked well for that application, but also for many other jobs that always seem to pop up around the house. This is a nice buget friendly tool. At four inches in length, it's small enough to fit easily in a pocket or purse. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Davis

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I already have bite marks in it from wrenching down on things so the tool steel likely isn't tool steel. But it gets the job done for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: It's a wrench...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for a "cheap" tool. Great for infrequent use, better than Harbor Freight quality but not mechanic's quality.
customer_reviews.author: JLo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at an amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: No idea how financially it made sense to ship this in two days for free (love Prime), but this is surprisingly a good quality. As you'd expect, this thing is heavy! Perfect for bending things, tightening large bolts or bashing in the heads of nearby zombies. The thumb adjuster is smooth and tight with almost no slop. The adjustable jaw is nearly parallel to the fixed one- definitely more than close enough for my uses.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Turner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool manageable size with heft to it get job done and makes you smile to use it..great tool!
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Ing

customer_reviews.title: You dont always need a big adjustable but when you do it will get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive option for a large adjustable, mine came with a couple sharp burrs that will cut so before handling I'd make sure it doesnt have any rough edges. Other than that perfect for a beat around wrench
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas S.

customer_reviews.title: Enormous, it is like a movie prop it's so big.
customer_reviews.text: Photo for size comparison to my torso. I didn't really check the photos in the reviews so I didn't realize just how big this thing actually is. I could take down street lights with this thing. There is probably a lighter and more efficient tool out there then this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Hartman

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be good quality. The adjustment is smooth
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to straighten a heavy aluminum hinge that was bent. It seems to be good quality. The adjustment is smooth, and there isn't much play.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Different from product photo
customer_reviews.text: The wrench I received is nothing like the Amazon picture shows - both the packaging, and the wrench form are different. It is blister packaged, the packaging is yellow, it is labeled "Olympia tools", but the wrench itself doesn't have the brand name embossed on the handle, instead is has it inscribed on the head. The shape is very different too - the one I got, has bigger head and shorter handle. Otherwise it's ok (didn't test it yet though), just not what I expected based on product photo.
customer_reviews.author: DVR

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: Well made considering it's made in China. Does what I need it to do and I do not worry about breaking it.
customer_reviews.author: Hemmi06

customer_reviews.title: Heck of a wrench!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good time, it was listed as very good/used. Had original sticker it looks like from original purchase and no scratches. I haven't test loaded the heck out of it yet but adjustable wrenches this size you about have to be a special type of dumb to break it. I painted mine blue to match all my other gear.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas in TN

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst purchases in my life. Honestly ready to kill myself.
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the worst purchases in my life. It's stuck to my showerhead. I tried dissembling the crescent wrench but the divot for the screw head is so short that it won't budge. Tried everything to take it off. Am I supposed to now cut off the pipe? $20 product might require a few hundred or thousand dollars worth of work considering I'm putting strain on my pipes.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty - holds up to abuse
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised, quality fit and finish. Needed a large open end wrench to hold very large pinion nut on transfer case pinion shaft to break loose when doing transfer case rebuilds. It was actually cheaper to buy this adjustable and tig weld it permanently to the size I needed than buy a fixed correct size open end wrench. So I can't speak of the adjustable part as I tig welded it to a permanent size. But it holds up to heavy duty high torque impact gun, while I have this wrench tightened in a bench vice. No flaking or chipping.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja Performance

customer_reviews.title: it's huge. too big. had to return
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something with a long arm for leverage. But the head is so huge that I couldn't get it into place to use. That's my fault, not that of the tool. Still I had to return it because I can't imagine a scenario where this would be of use for me. It is massive and heavy. Maybe useful for self defense?
customer_reviews.author: phegos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality wrench.
customer_reviews.text: I was nicely surprised at the excellent quality of this 24 inch Olympia Tool Wrench. For the price I was worried it might HF quality but it is easily equivalent to any Craftsman wrench I have seen. It actually looks much better in person than in the web page photo. More than satisfied with value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. ROBBINS

customer_reviews.title: About what I expected. It is a very big ...
customer_reviews.text: About what I expected. It is a very big Crescent Wrench. You get what you pay for. I needed two of these to be able to adjust the mechanism on big powered airplane hanger door. The nuts are over 2" in size and I decided adjustable wrenches would be more usable than a fixed size wrench. They seem to hold their size even when putting maximum pressure on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: BMWRider

customer_reviews.title: got it
customer_reviews.text: got this so I could change my cooling fan clich on my truck its a 1999 chevy before they went elect fans
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: 24” wrench does not open as wide as claims
customer_reviews.text: Mine only opens to 60 MM (actually 2.365 “ with caliper). I don’t need a wrench this big very often (hence looking for value pricing) but when i do i need 2 7/16 “ (2.4375” or 62mm) i thought the claimed 2 1/2 “ 64mm would be fine. Wrench seems decently well made but worth zero to me since it can’t handle the size i need.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Big wrench, busts fat nuts
customer_reviews.text: Suckin thing is huge! Bought it specifically to bust nuts off rusty trailer hitches. It does have a little play in adjustment knob when clamped on a nut, but it worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Not2important

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Got it for $11.x which is nice. Happened to need one to fix my bathroom and it did the work. It’s not super hard material I guess but not bad at all. Made quality is OK. But for this price I would still rate it with 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: It's 4 Inches
customer_reviews.text: The product description under "further product details" list this wrench as 5.2 inches for some reason. Fact is, it's 4 inches from tip to tip. Sturdy little guy for small jobs. Just be sure you can wait 9 days for it to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: mike malachowski

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Crescent wrench
customer_reviews.text: Very good value for a larger size Crescent wrench. Perfect for occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sjoman

customer_reviews.title: ... and this made that take only five minutes very good tool and a long handle for leverage
customer_reviews.text: To get take off my fan I have one of those big clutch nuts and this made that take only five minutes very good tool and a long handle for leverage. Though not sure well else I can use it for since its massive but if you need to take off a fan clutch this is the tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Campbell

customer_reviews.title: This crescent is perfect for uses that are intermittent or when you are ...
customer_reviews.text: This crescent is perfect for uses that are intermittent or when you are supplying to employees that lose tools. It will do the job, but the steel is not as tough as a better quality tool and over time the adjustment function will become more and more loose. However at this price level the tool is a bargain and will work for most folks. If you are going to be using it day in day out I would suggest something a little tougher.
customer_reviews.author: The_Anarchist

customer_reviews.title: This is the Real Deal !
customer_reviews.text: Amazing 15" Wrench, HEAVY Duty! Adjustments don't slip as in some of the other lower priced adjustable wrenches I'm surprised that at under $12.00, it's as good as a $35.00 to $45.00 price range Crescent brand wrench No tool box should be without one of these, I found out the hard way by damaging a delicate plumbing by part using a Channel Lock, which normally be fine for it's other intended uses of course. Can't wait to try the 18" and 24" but I'll wait until I actually need one
customer_reviews.author: Frank M.

customer_reviews.title: Way bigger than I expected because I didn't read the description well enough
customer_reviews.text: I meant to buy something a lot smaller than this, but it turned out for the best because I wound up needing the extra leverage a week later when I needed to remove an older style BB bracket from a bike. Solid, heavy, and the large size gives plenty of leverage even for smaller scale tasks.
customer_reviews.author: stormbeta

customer_reviews.title: Heavy wrench
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. A lot heavier that other 24" wrenches I have seen. Close in mass to my 36" wrench. It can double as a war club if you can lift it.
customer_reviews.author: DCL

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is as sturdy and well-made as any wrench you would find at a home improvement store. Incredible amount of leverage for the price. I bought this 15-inch wrench instead of a much pricier 18 or 21 inch and it was all I needed (for removing an incredibly stubborn freewheel and bottom bracket cup threaded on probably without grease). For my bike, this gets the job done better than my channel lock and without the damage from the toothed jaws (useful for freewheel, bottom bracket, headset). On another note, I agree with another reviewer that you could most likely use this for effective self-defense. Very heavy-duty wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Maung

customer_reviews.title: Okay Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Nice wrench. Has a little play in it but is okay. Use it on wheel bearing spindle nuts so don’t put much torque in this when using it.
customer_reviews.author: NBB

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for 2" threaded PVC
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a HUGE adjustable wrench, look no further. This wrench removes 2" PVC connections with ease and doesn't leave tool marks like a pipe wrench. I highly recommend for those of us who have common replaceable components like a chem-free system on our pool equipment.
customer_reviews.author: D. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing tools I purchased 2 15inch wrenches as a diesel tech with a limited toolbox I was not looking forward to purchasing mega wrench sets I have been able to avoid that by purchasing two of these they work excellent on large steel air lines hydraulic lines among others
customer_reviews.author: DillonK

customer_reviews.title: Super value for the job
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool for the task.. something large that I use rarely. It isn’t fine machined but great value
customer_reviews.author: R. Gard

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Some people say this is just a wrench. But I say nay!!! This is much more than just a wrench. This is an adjustable wrench. And it’s bigger than my... ego! Which is pretty large. Hehe. Buy this thing as soon as you can scrape togeather the pennies and enjoy all of the large nuts you can twist off with this amazing piece of metal.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Wolfe V

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with it. It is very heavy. The adjustment mechanism is very smooth and sure. I believe the name brand counter-parts Are several times more expensive than this.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Big ass wrench.
customer_reviews.text: The one thing I wanted to know was how wide did the wrench open and none of the descriptions nor reviews stated that. So for those wondering it opens to 2.5 inches. Other than that it's an adjustable wrench like any other.
customer_reviews.author: Jared B

customer_reviews.title: This wrench is big
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice wrench smooth rolling non flimsy. Sturdy and strong. The roller does have a little play in it but it does stay in place and doesn't open up. I give this tool 5 stars based on price to quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mec. Noman

customer_reviews.title: VERY USEFUL
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful tool Many uses. It is well made, and assists in more than just rotating nuts. I used it too nudge and guide a massive radiator into position, after connecting, by using as crow bar against floor. At this length, makes hard exertions easy, without having to find a pipe extension. Handle is slim to fit lightweight pipes too.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R.

customer_reviews.title: Great wrench to have
customer_reviews.text: You should buy it. Comes in handy all the time for nuts that won’t fit in a 12” crescent
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price for a seldom used tool.
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this wrench very often but when I have, it has worked very well. I couldn't see spending $60+ on a name brand tool that I would rarely need so I purchased this Olympia adjustable wrench. For tightening trailer hitch balls and tractor linkage bolts, it has been invaluable and I highly recommend it. I see no issues with quality at all. You will not be disappointed by a cheap crude piece of junk. This is a well made tool that works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Fireballsocal

customer_reviews.title: not a pro-level tool, but all i need!
customer_reviews.text: despite responses to the contrary, “lifetime guarantee” was written right on the label. fit and finish is more than acceptable. not a thing of beauty, but perfectly functional for my needs...
customer_reviews.author: jct111

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my water pump job!!
customer_reviews.text: Opted to buy a variable tool other than a specialty tool for my Chevy. Worked great and now I can use it for other repairs too rather than have a specialty tool dying in the toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal and great quality product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This wrench is a beast!!! Perfect for those oversized tow hitch nuts!
customer_reviews.author: Da hammah

customer_reviews.title: Looked used  when recurved
customer_reviews.text: This item looked used when I received it. Multiple scratches and Knicks
customer_reviews.author: kay wehrle

customer_reviews.title: I Like This...
customer_reviews.text: Have a full set of these adjustable wrenches. They work as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Hemmi06

customer_reviews.title: Nice wrench
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on my disc for the axle nuts, So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: Nothing much to say about a wrench. It's well made and works as it should. Easy to adjust, fits well.
customer_reviews.author: John Rowell

customer_reviews.title: Works well for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Used to expensive Craftsman & SnapOn tools. Surprising this tool is of great value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Paul

customer_reviews.title: BIG wrench
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought the 18" wrench, but the opening was 1/16" too small. So I bought this one. The Olympia web site says opens to 2-1/2", mine measures 2.583." The picture looks like the handle is too skinny, not so -- the handle is also huge, 2" wide and 0.6" thick in the middle. The jaws aren't as precise as the 18" model, but still okay.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D

customer_reviews.title: Huge wrench at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price, I found this the cheaper option for a job that required 2 large-size specific wrenches the dealership was trying to sell me for a lot more and now have a huge adjustable for my tool box, actually its hanging up because its huge. You can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Keyth Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Price fit
customer_reviews.text: I will probably only use this a few times but it will do the job for sure .
customer_reviews.author: Glasses

customer_reviews.title: Big adjustable wrench
customer_reviews.text: It's big and adjustable. Needed it for one pipe connection (1" union) and was the best priced wrench that I could find that went above 1-1/2 inch. Worked great and stays set at the size you adjust it to. Nice weight too. Feels durable
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: HUGE
customer_reviews.text: love the price, and the size. excellent build quality (seemingly at least). I didn't require anything too hard or massive with it, but i'm sure it'll hold up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Stargate fans this is the one
customer_reviews.text: It’s the Stargate wrench It was the cheapest 24 inch adjustable wrench I could find on Amazon but it is still pretty good quality
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Pretty lose and bigger than expected (my fault on that ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty lose and bigger than expected (my fault on that part.) It's cheap and makes a decent self defense club though.
customer_reviews.author: A Axeen

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works ok good for the money, cheap made but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: jon s.

customer_reviews.title: 1990 Mazda Miata.
customer_reviews.text: 1990 Mazda Miata. Lol it's a big wrench. I used it to lock my cams together when doing my timing belt.
customer_reviews.author: Steve JS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent crescent wrench
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. Excellent crescent wrench. I work on a lot of hydraulic applications, and these come in handy on the bigger fittings. A must have!
customer_reviews.author: SherriC1978

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 15" inch version in 2017 for about $15. It's worth that, I suppose, just to have available in a tractor toolbox for an odd job. Unfortunately, the spanner part is quite loose and sloppy. You get what you pay for, and there are certainly better tools available.
customer_reviews.author: MixedNuts

customer_reviews.title: Large product...
customer_reviews.text: The thing is really big and heavy ! Not for ladies or seniors.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Keane

customer_reviews.title: Great wrench
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for taking off the inner tie rod on my 1/2 ton Chevy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Lunceford

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Us this15" adjustable wrench to tighten hydraulic hoses on log splitter. Works fine, doesn't drift and is a heck of a lot cheaper than some of the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Earl D Walker

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it if you need it
customer_reviews.text: It works, and it's less expensive than most but not built cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: Fubar Sean Keating

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for 2007 GMC Envoy Denali V8 Fan Clutch removal ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 2007 GMC Envoy Denali V8 Fan Clutch removal. A little too thick, but it did the job. I will grind it thinner if needed again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed for my Nova lathe chuck
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t get my lathe chuck off one time. I ordered this because it opens wide enough for the chuck insert. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Engineering Geek

customer_reviews.title: I needed a big wrench so I could get enough ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a big wrench so I could get enough torque to remove a bathtub drain. This was solid, study and functions just as I would have hoped. I may have gone overkill but there is something about holding a big metal wrench that feels manly.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I needed one of these for my welding cart. ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed one of these for my welding cart. Getting the fittings off the gas cylinders requires a large wrench and this fits them all.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gradwohl

customer_reviews.title: This is the type of wrench that you will be glad that you have
customer_reviews.text: Size does matter! This is the type of wrench that you will be glad that you have. It is useful for that trailer hitch or the bolts on an implement that needs to be tightened. The jaws open to 2.5 inches and the handle gives you plenty of leverage. You can even slip a cheater bar on it. Yeah, it's not a precision instrument, but it's enough to get the job done. The price is reasonable and there is no danger of putting in your back pocket and finding it in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Don Young

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Husband requested a 2 foot wrench , seems to be helpful on stubborn boat motors
customer_reviews.author: Krissy Noel

customer_reviews.title: As expected and arrived in good time. seams to be pretty rugged for the ...
customer_reviews.text: As expected and arrived in good time. seams to be pretty rugged for the cost and the finish has a satin look.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL T.

customer_reviews.title: Thick A$$ monster wrench
customer_reviews.text: Crazy heavy.. heavier and beefier and wider than the craftsman and the ones they sell at tractor supply
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really did not realize how large this would be ...
customer_reviews.text: I really did not realize how large this would be, it is massive. I use it to adjust the head nut on bicycles and as a defensive implement should I need to do so. Feels a little cheap for something so large but it works, so I cant complain.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan W.

customer_reviews.title: Big.
customer_reviews.text: Big and strong. Jaws are not overly wide so it fits more things.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for the tool and I hope it will serve for the purpose of which I got it.
customer_reviews.author: King of The Jungle

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Nice wrench for the money, seems well built. Shipping was a little longer than expected, kept having delays.
customer_reviews.author: K Moore

customer_reviews.title: Wrenchiest wrench in the world
customer_reviews.text: This is a wrench of a wrench. I'm not sure I'm man enough to wield this monster.
customer_reviews.author: HoleeG

customer_reviews.title: Allows for awesome torque
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge, heavy, and hilarious. I love it. Works well on my road bike.
customer_reviews.author: HW Chang

customer_reviews.title: Big wrench, nice price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a big wrench. Quality could be better but good enough for anything around the homestead and at the right price.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Able to get after larger bills/nuts on equipment and machinery
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This wrench was a terrific solution to going out and buying jumbo combo wrenches
customer_reviews.text: This wrench was a terrific solution to going out and buying jumbo combo wrenches. It was the only wrench that would crack this super tough nut I had to remove. I'm not sorry I bought it for that one job. I'm glad I have this in my tool box. No cheater pipe necessary!
customer_reviews.author: BhamKen

customer_reviews.title: Great wrench, but..
customer_reviews.text: Great wrench, looks very strong, and nice to hold. BUT, the wrench only opens to 2.105", and I need 2.146." The Olympia web site says "2-1/4"/57MM JAW OPENING" For the price, this isn't worth returning or arguing about.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Operating Wrench for larger bolts
customer_reviews.text: Really nice wrench for larger bolts...opens to 1 7/8" with very smooth operation. I have two now.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Didn't open as wide as my 12" adjustable. Didn't use it much. Ended up in yard sale pile. Would recommend a different brand
customer_reviews.author: lucas evert

customer_reviews.title: Nice wrench
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive adjustable wrench that does the job. I have another one which was more expensive and it's finished better than the Olympia, but this one works just as well. Nice wrench for the money.
customer_reviews.author: George G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like a big a$$ wrench should. I'm glad its now in my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H

customer_reviews.title: seems very nice. Not to much play in them
customer_reviews.text: Big, seems very nice. Not to much play in them.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W Reid

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 24" wrench. The castings seem to be ok so it should be plenty strong. But the wrench I recieved opens up to 2-3/16". Making it 5/16" shy of 2-1/2" claimed jaw opening
customer_reviews.author: T.Pyle

customer_reviews.title: Large wrench with acceptable quality
customer_reviews.text: This was an import, and I bought it to back-up an American wrench I've had thirty years [Montgomery Ward era]. There are cosmetic differences between the two, but, with adjustable wrenches, tolerances are less of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: King Waters

customer_reviews.title: The Big Boy
customer_reviews.text: This is a wrench that Goliath could use in his tool box. No lie! This thing is huge. I finally have a wrench that I can get some serious toque on it. Very useful for changing the ball on the hitch. Buy it, you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Navy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Giant wrench
customer_reviews.text: Great product I’ll buy one again but to bad somebody stole it at work
customer_reviews.author: Gerald lucero

customer_reviews.title: and works fine for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: It's a big wrench, and works fine for my purposes, don't use it much, but when you need it, you need it. It's good enough for casual use. Gotta love flintstone-sized tools.
customer_reviews.author: John Duff

customer_reviews.title: This is a great heavy duty wrench.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great heavy duty wrench. Used first to remove power steering pitman arm from a 13 year old Land Rover. Took a lot to get off, but this wrench did the trick. Highly recommend. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality on an inexpensive wrench. As I think someone else mentioned, I need to switch back and forth trailer hitch balls between a 2" and 1 7/8" and that nut on the bottom is like 1 1/2". Absolutly no problem with a 15 inch wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Eyeguys

customer_reviews.title: Wrench Away!!
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad tool. Works as I need it too. Yes, it is made in China but quality has not been compromised.
customer_reviews.author: Hemmi06

customer_reviews.title: A decent HUGE wench
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge adjustable wrench at a very decent price. People would often use a pipe wrench or channel locks instead for the things this wrench fits. I bought it for some plumbing fittings that I didn't want to scratch. I liked it so much I also purchased the 15 inch version.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Bottorff

customer_reviews.title: more than happy..
customer_reviews.text: at a fraction of the price of some of the main big name tool companies ... so far as i can tell, this is just as strong and works just as smooth ... more than happy ... with it ... and i still have a 30+ buck difference still in my wallet ..
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and effective.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to deal with tight bicycle bottom brackets. It worked great. Also works great on cassette / freewheel removers as the length of the wrench is about the same as the radius of the wheel. Net-net it makes easy work of stuff that a 10 or 12 inch wrench cannot do easily. It's fun to show people as well. It's big enough compared to a 10 or 12 inch wrench to be a bit surprising. After that they recognize that it would make an effective weapon.
customer_reviews.author: RandomGravy

customer_reviews.title: I was Impressed for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a large adjustable, this 15" does the job for a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Ferrigno

product_meta.title: Olympia Tools Adjustable Wrench 01-015, 15 Inches
product_meta.description:
Size:15-InchOlympia Tools 01-015 15-Inch Adjustable Wrench 1-3/4" Opening, Hardened & Tempered Drop Forged Alloy Steel, Chrome Plated Corrosion Resist

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Olympia Tools International engineers, develops, markets, and distributes high quality hand tools at an affordable price. Olympia adjustable wrenches are hardened and tempered with precision machined jaws and a knurled adjusting worm.
feature_bullets: SMOOTH TWIST: Our adjustable wrench is hardened & tempered drop forged alloy steel. It’s a much needed tool for your vehicle & other minor/major fixes. It has adjustable jaws for easy access to small areas.

FIXES & REPAIRS: Our product features widespread jaw size for a wide range of nuts and bolts fastenings. It can be used for plumbing, automotive repairs, vehicle maintenance and furniture assembling tasks.
MADE TO LAST: Our durable and long-lasting tools help you with home, garage & industrial projects. With professional-grade quality, easily repair & fix issues with our tool cabinet essentials.

THE RIGHT TOOL FOR THE JOB: We engineer a range of bolt cutters, clamps, chisels, folding carts, hammers, pliers, saws, screwdrivers, tape measures, utility knives, vises, bolt cutters, saws & wrenches.
SUPERIOR INSTRUMENTS: Olympia Tools provides quality & innovative hand & specialty tools, tool accessories & outdoor equipment for construction, woodworking, mechanical maintenance & home repair.
